info.description: The Claim Evidence Application Programming Interface (API) is file service for handling the storage and management of files supporting VA benefit claims. It serves as a modernized point of entry to files previously only accessible through VBMS eFolder. It is designed for easier implementation by consuming systems, but also with the ability to eventually replace the eFolder logic within VBMS.
info.title: Claim Evidence API.

post.description: ### Searches files by provided FolderIdentifier, and search request filers.

parameters.description:
The Folder Identifier that the file will be associated to. The example provided is for identifying a veteran.

**Header Format**: folder-type:identifier-type:ID

**Valid Folder-Types**:

* VETERAN - Allows: FILENUMBER, SSN, PARTICIPANT_ID, SEARCH, and EDIPI
* PERSON - Allows: PARTICIPANT_ID, SEARCH

For search identifiers as a type, the ssn, date of birth, last name, and first name must be supplied on the ID field as query params encoded.
parameters.name: X-Folder-URI

200.description: Search was successful given provided search request.

400.description: Server was unable to understand the request. This may come back as an empty response if the json is malformed or not understood by the server.

401.description: The authentication mechanism failed and hence access is forbidden.

403.description: The request is not authorized.  Please verify credentials used in the request.

500.description: There was an error encountered processing the Request.  Response will contain a  "messages" element that will provide further information on the error.  Please retry.  If problem persists, please contact support with a copy of the Response.

post.description: ### Upload a file. This endpoint when given a file and associated data returns a UUID which can be used to retrieve back the latest data provided. Information on how to properly create a payload object for this endpoint is available in the schema section here. (Upload Payload)

parameters.description:
The Folder Identifier that the file will be associated to. The example provided is for identifying a veteran.

**Header Format**: folder-type:identifier-type:ID

**Valid Folder-Types**:

* VETERAN - Allows: FILENUMBER, SSN, PARTICIPANT_ID, SEARCH, ICN and EDIPI
* PERSON - Allows: PARTICIPANT_ID, SEARCH

For search identifiers as a type, the ssn, date of birth, last name, and first name must be supplied on the ID field as query params encoded.
parameters.name: X-Folder-URI

200.description: Response containing the file UUID, the owner, and the calculated MD5 Hash. As well as conversion information if the document has been converted.

400.description: Server was unable to understand the request. This may come back as an empty response if the json is malformed or not understood by the server.

401.description: JWT contains claims which indicate the consumer is not authorized to access the resource.

403.description: JWT contains claims which indicate the consumer is not authorized to access the resource

415.description: Unsupported Media Type. This is common when uploading an unacceptable file type.

500.description: There was an error encountered processing the Request.  Response will contain a  "messages" element that will provide further information on the error.  Please retry.  If problem persists, please contact support with a copy of the Response.

post.summary: Upload a file with associated provider data

get.description: Retrieve file data.

parameters.description: The UUID of the file data.
parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: Optional param to include or exclude raw text data associated with the current version of the document in the response. Default behavior is exclusion. Providers must implement processing of this flag in their corresponding handler chain in order to utilize this addition to the default response. Valid values for this query parameter are "0"/"1" or "false"/"true"; anything else will result in a 400 Bad Request response.
parameters.name: includeRawTextData

200.description: File data is returned. If includeRawTextData is true, then raw text data associated with the file data will also be included in the response.

400.description: Server was unable to understand the request. This may come back as an empty response if the json is malformed or not understood by the server.

versionComposition.description: Response data containing the system and provider data for a file. This will always be a response containing the latest information for the file.

versionCompositionWithRawTextData.description: Response data containing the system, provider and raw text data for a file. This response will always contain the latest information for the file.

updateDataProviderData.description: Claim Evidence API Update Provider Data. This endpoint accepts any of the following properties, if you are only updating one property, it is possible to make the call with just one of them. For example if you wanted to just update subject, the request can be made with only the subject property in the providerData object on the request.

contentSource.description: String field designating the originating source of the content being uploaded. This must match a valid content source from the /contentSources endpoint. This can only be updated by a limited subset of users.
contentSource.title: Document content source

claimantFirstName.description: String field designating the Claimant's first name.
claimantFirstName.title: Claimant First Name

claimantMiddleInitial.description: String field designating the Claimant's middle initial.
claimantMiddleInitial.title: Claimant Middle Initial

claimantLastName.description: String field designating the Claimant's last name.
claimantLastName.title: Claimant Last Name

claimantSsn.description: String field designating the Claimant's SSN. Only accepts exactly 9 characters.
claimantSsn.title: Claimant SSN

benefitTypeId.description: Number field designating the Benefit Type ID.
benefitTypeId.title: Benefit Type ID

documentTypeId.description: Number field correlating to a Claim Evidence document type ID. Document types primary use is loosely categorizing their contents.
documentTypeId.title: Document Type ID

dateVaReceivedDocument.description: Date field indicating the date the VA received the document. This can be any date in format of YYYY-MM-DD from 1900 until today
dateVaReceivedDocument.title: Date VA Received Document

subject.description: Free text describing the document. This is primarily notes used to assist claim developers.
subject.title: Subject

alternativeDocumentTypeIds.description: List of integers which relate to an alternative document type Id. This must match a valid alternative document type Id from the /documentTypes endpoint.
alternativeDocumentTypeIds.title: Alternative Document Type Ids

actionable.description: Boolean true/false for if the document is considered 'actionable' or whether claim action can be taken based on the content.
actionable.title: Actionable

certified.description: Boolean true/false for if the document is considered 'certified'.
certified.title: Actionable

endProductCode.description: Free text describing the document. This is primarily notes used to assist claim developers. This field must match a valid known end product code.
endProductCode.title: Subject

notes.example: [This is a note for a document, These replace editing the document summary]
notes.title: Document Notes

sourceComment.description: String field containing any comments from the source of the document
sourceComment.title: Source comment

payeeCode.description: String field designating the Payee Code. Only accepts 2 digits as a string with leading 0 if below 10.
payeeCode.title: Payee Code

regionalProcessingOffice.description: String field designating the regional processing office.
regionalProcessingOffice.title: Regional Processing Office

facilityCode.description: String field designating the Facility Code.
facilityCode.title: Facility Code

claimantParticipantId.description: String field designating the claimant participant Id.
claimantParticipantId.title: Claimant Participant Id

newMail.title: New Mail

contentName.description: The content name of the document being uploaded. This must be unique for the folder being uploaded to. For instance the document "pdf.pdf" cannot be uploaded twice for fileNumber 987654321. The acceptable file extensions are png, pdf, tif, tiff, txt, jpg, jpeg, and bmp.

comment.example: Comments have a max of 100 characters
Can have some special characters and Numbers {}>>?
Comments are not required, with the exception of deferral bookmark types
Need at least one character in comment for this bookmark type
Only one instance of each bookmark type is allowed per file
Comments will update when resending a bookmark type
